company.tagline: Deploy ML models to production, faster
company.description: Baseten provides infrastructure for deploying and serving machine learning models at scale. The platform enables data science teams to deploy models to production without complex DevOps, offering serverless inference, autoscaling, and monitoring capabilities.
company.target_customers: ML engineers, data science teams, AI-first companies

growth_metrics.geographic_expansion: Downsized NYC office in September 2024, shifted to remote-first model
growth_metrics.customer_growth: Steady but slower than projected, focusing on enterprise customers
growth_metrics.revenue_info: Revenue growth at 60% YoY, down from 180% previous year

media_coverage: TechCrunch: Baseten raises $100M Series B for ML deployment platform
The Information: AI infrastructure startups face margin pressure
VentureBeat: Baseten introduces private cloud deployment options

events.title: Baseten raises $100M Series B at $650M valuation
events.description: Led by Spark Capital with participation from IVP, Greylock, and new investor Kleiner Perkins. Funding to accelerate enterprise sales and expand platform capabilities.

events.title: Company announces restructuring and 25% workforce reduction
events.description: Baseten lays off approximately 25 employees (22% of workforce) citing need to 'extend runway' and 'focus on core product-market fit.' Layoffs primarily affected go-to-market and customer success teams. CEO stated company remains well-capitalized but needs to achieve profitability sooner.

events.title: Major customer outage lasting 4 hours
events.description: Baseten platform experienced significant downtime affecting production ML inference for multiple enterprise customers. Post-mortem cited infrastructure misconfiguration during deployment. Several customers reported revenue impact.

events.title: Controversy over GPU availability and pricing transparency
events.description: Multiple customers complained on social media about lack of GPU availability during high-demand periods and unexpected billing charges. Company faced criticism for poor communication and unclear pricing documentation.

events.title: VP of Engineering departs amid restructuring
events.description: Longtime VP of Engineering left company following September layoffs. Role remains unfilled as company reassesses engineering leadership structure.

leadership.name: Amir Haghighat
leadership.title: CEO & Co-Founder
leadership.background: Former ML engineer at Uber, Stanford Computer Science

leadership.name: Sarah Mitchell
leadership.title: CFO
leadership.background: Former finance exec at Snowflake, Goldman Sachs

leadership.name: Position Open
leadership.title: VP of Engineering (Vacant since November 2024)
leadership.background: Previous VP departed following restructuring in September 2024

leadership.name: Kevin Park
leadership.title: VP of Product
leadership.background: Former PM at Google Cloud AI Platform

products.name: Baseten Platform
products.description: Serverless ML inference platform for deploying models to production with autoscaling and monitoring

products.name: Truss
products.description: Open-source model packaging framework for standardizing ML model deployment

products.name: Model Registry
products.description: Centralized model versioning and management system

products.name: Private Cloud Deployment
products.description: Self-hosted version of Baseten platform for enterprise security requirements

missing_fields: Full financial impact of October outage

confidence_notes.revenue_range: Estimated based on publicly stated growth rates and industry benchmarks
confidence_notes.customer_count: Approximate based on company marketing materials
confidence_notes.outage_impact: Customer-reported impacts not officially confirmed by company

analyst_notes: ⚠️ HIGH RISK PROFILE: Baseten shows multiple red flags including significant workforce reduction (22% layoffs) just 3 months after raising $100M Series B, major production outage affecting enterprise customers, VP of Engineering departure, public controversy over pricing and GPU availability, and sharply declining growth rates. While company has solid funding and runway, operational execution issues and team instability raise serious concerns about ability to scale and compete in crowded ML infrastructure market.
risks: Recent 22% workforce reduction (25 employees) only 3 months after $100M Series B raise - suggests burn rate concerns
Major 4-hour production outage in October 2024 affecting enterprise customers - reliability concerns
VP of Engineering departure following layoffs - critical technical leadership gap
Public controversy over GPU availability and pricing transparency - customer trust issues
Negative headcount growth (-22% YoY) indicating organizational contraction despite recent funding
Slowing revenue growth (180% → 60% YoY) suggests product-market fit challenges
Moderate Glassdoor rating (3.4/5) with recent reviews mentioning 'layoffs' and 'uncertainty'
Flat website traffic growth suggests weak market demand or brand awareness
Intense competition from well-funded competitors (Replicate, Modal, Hugging Face)
Customer complaints about service reliability and billing practices - retention risk
Infrastructure scalability concerns evident from outage and GPU availability issues
opportunities: Strong investor backing with $145M raised and 30+ months runway
Growing enterprise AI/ML deployment market (projected $50B+ by 2028)
Strategic partnerships with major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Snowflake)
Open source Truss framework has strong GitHub community (2,845 stars)
Recent launch of Private Cloud offering addresses enterprise security concerns
Experienced leadership team from top tech companies (Uber, Pinterest, Google, Snowflake)
Y Combinator alumni with strong network
Shift to remote-first reduces overhead costs
